Search

Aaardvark

Aardvarks are mammals that look like they were made from parts of other animals. An aardvark has a long snout that ends with a pig-like nose, rabbit-like ears and a tail similar to a kangaroo's. Yet it is not closely related to any of those animals. Aardvarks are found throughout sub-Saharan Africa.

Ref: Facts About Aardvarks | Live Sciencehttps://www.livescience.com › 55241-aardvark-facts

Armadillo

Armadillos can be found in many different habitats of South America, ranging from grassland to rainforest, but are mainly found on open plains. They have five toes on each foot equipped with sharp claws that are well developed for digging. These solitary creatures keep their dens for longer than other species.

Aquarium

Discover how fish have adapted to some of the world’s most challenging habitats. With over 300 sea water creatures such as fish, turtles, eels, shellfish, sharks and octopus.

Asian Elephant

Asian elephants are the continent's largest terrestrial mammals. They can reach 6.4m in length and 3m at the shoulder, and weigh as much as 5 tonnes. They are smaller than African elephants and have proportionally smaller ears, which they keep in constant motion in order to cool themselves.

Ref: Asian elephants | WWFhttps://wwf.panda.org › discover › endangered_species

Bornean Orangutan

The orangutan, with its distinctive red-orange hair, is the only ape that inhabits Asia. Weighing up to 90 kg (200 lb.), the Bornean orangutan is about 1-1.5 m tall (3.5-4.5 ft.) with an arm span as long as 2.5 m (8 ft.).

Ref: Bornean Orangutan Facts | Endangered Animals

Black Rhino

As the saying goes, rhinos do have thick skin, but they can still get sun burnt. Rhinoceros is a Greek word. Black rhinos are the third biggest of the five types of rhino.

Black Lemur

Not all black lemurs are coloured black. The fur of a male lemur is either very dark brown or black, whereas females are a much lighter shade of brown making it easy to tell them apart.

Ref: Black Lemur | Meet Our Animals | Plan Your Visit | Chester Zoohttps://www.chesterzoo.org › our-zoo › black-lemur

Caribbean Flamingo

Caribbean flamingos are tall, large bodied birds with long necks and small heads. Most flamingos have bright pink or crimson plumage, legs, and bills. The Caribbean flamingo is by far the brightest and one of the largest of all the flamingos. Size Approximately 80–145 cm (31–57 in.)

Ref: Caribbean Flamingo Facts and Information | SeaWorld Parks ...https://seaworld.org › animals › facts › birds › caribbea...

Chimpanzee

Chimpanzees are one of four types of “great ape.” The great apes are: chimpanzees, bonobos, gorillas, and orangutans. Wild chimpanzees only live in Africa.

Ref: Chimp Facts - Jane Goodall Institute UKhttps://www.janegoodall.org.uk › chimpanzee-central
